001// Copyright (c) Choreo contributors
002
003package choreo.auto;
004
005import choreo.Choreo;
006import choreo.Choreo.TrajectoryLogger;
007import choreo.auto.AutoFactory.AutoBindings;
008import choreo.trajectory.DifferentialSample;
009import choreo.trajectory.SwerveSample;
010import choreo.trajectory.Trajectory;
011import choreo.trajectory.TrajectorySample;
012import choreo.util.AllianceFlipUtil;
013import edu.wpi.first.math.geometry.Pose2d;
014import edu.wpi.first.math.geometry.Translation2d;
015import edu.wpi.first.math.util.Units;
016import edu.wpi.first.wpilibj.DriverStation;
017import edu.wpi.first.wpilibj.Timer;
018import edu.wpi.first.wpilibj2.command.Command;
019import edu.wpi.first.wpilibj2.command.FunctionalCommand;
020import edu.wpi.first.wpilibj2.command.Subsystem;
021import edu.wpi.first.wpilibj2.command.button.Trigger;
022import java.util.Optional;
023import java.util.function.BiConsumer;
024import java.util.function.BooleanSupplier;
025import java.util.function.Supplier;
026
027/**
028 * A class that represents a trajectory that can be used in an autonomous routine and have triggers
029 * based off of it.
030 */
031public class AutoTrajectory {
032  // For any devs looking through this class wondering
033  // about all the type casting and `?` for generics it's intentional.
034  // My goal was to make the sample type minimally leak into user code
035  // so you don't have to retype the sample type everywhere in your auto
036  // code. This also makes the places with generics exposed to users few
037  // and far between. This helps with more novice users
038
039  private static final double DEFAULT_TOLERANCE_METERS = Units.inchesToMeters(3);
040
041  private final String name;
042  private final Trajectory<? extends TrajectorySample<?>> trajectory;
043  private final TrajectoryLogger<? extends TrajectorySample<?>> trajectoryLogger;
044  private final Supplier<Pose2d> poseSupplier;
045  private final BiConsumer<Pose2d, ? extends TrajectorySample<?>> controller;
046  private final BooleanSupplier mirrorTrajectory;
047  private final Timer timer = new Timer();
048  private final Subsystem driveSubsystem;
049  private final AutoRoutine routine;
050
051  /**
052   * A way to create slightly less triggers for alot of actions. Not static as to not leak triggers
053   * made here into another static EventLoop.
054   */
055  private final Trigger offTrigger;
056
057  /** If this trajectory us currently running */
058  private boolean isActive = false;
059
060  /** If the trajectory ran to completion */
061  private boolean isCompleted = false;
062
063  /** The time that the previous trajectories took up */
064  private double timeOffset = 0.0;
065
066  /**
067   * Constructs an AutoTrajectory.
068   *
069   * @param name The trajectory name.
070   * @param trajectory The trajectory samples.
071   * @param poseSupplier The pose supplier.
072   * @param controller The controller function.
073   * @param mirrorTrajectory Getter that determines whether to mirror trajectory.
074   * @param trajectoryLogger Optional trajectory logger.
075   * @param driveSubsystem Drive subsystem.
076   * @param routine Event loop.
077   * @param bindings {@link Choreo#createAutoFactory}
078   */
079  <SampleType extends TrajectorySample<SampleType>> AutoTrajectory(
080      String name,
081      Trajectory<SampleType> trajectory,
082      Supplier<Pose2d> poseSupplier,
083      BiConsumer<Pose2d, SampleType> controller,
084      BooleanSupplier mirrorTrajectory,
085      Optional<TrajectoryLogger<SampleType>> trajectoryLogger,
086      Subsystem driveSubsystem,
087      AutoRoutine routine,
088      AutoBindings bindings) {
089    this.name = name;
090    this.trajectory = trajectory;
091    this.poseSupplier = poseSupplier;
092    this.controller = controller;
093    this.mirrorTrajectory = mirrorTrajectory;
094    this.driveSubsystem = driveSubsystem;
095    this.routine = routine;
096    this.offTrigger = new Trigger(routine.loop(), () -> false);
097    this.trajectoryLogger =
098        trajectoryLogger.isPresent()
099            ? trajectoryLogger.get()
100            : new TrajectoryLogger<SampleType>() {
101              public void accept(Trajectory<SampleType> t, Boolean u) {}
102            };
103
104    bindings.getBindings().forEach((key, value) -> active().and(atTime(key)).onTrue(value));
105  }
106
107  /**
108   * Returns the time since the start of the current trajectory
109   *
110   * @return The time since the start of the current trajectory
111   */
112  private double timeIntoTrajectory() {
113    return timer.get() + timeOffset;
114  }
115
116  /**
117   * Returns the total time of all the trajectories
118   *
119   * @return The total time of all the trajectories
120   */
121  private double totalTime() {
122    return trajectory.getTotalTime();
123  }
124
125  @SuppressWarnings("unchecked")
126  private void logTrajectory(boolean starting) {
127    TrajectorySample<?> sample = trajectory.getInitialSample();
128    if (sample == null) {
129      return;
130    } else if (sample instanceof SwerveSample) {
131      TrajectoryLogger<SwerveSample> swerveLogger =
132          (TrajectoryLogger<SwerveSample>) trajectoryLogger;
133      Trajectory<SwerveSample> swerveTrajectory = (Trajectory<SwerveSample>) trajectory;
134      swerveLogger.accept(swerveTrajectory, starting);
135    } else if (sample instanceof DifferentialSample) {
136      TrajectoryLogger<DifferentialSample> differentialLogger =
137          (TrajectoryLogger<DifferentialSample>) trajectoryLogger;
138      Trajectory<DifferentialSample> differentialTrajectory =
139          (Trajectory<DifferentialSample>) trajectory;
140      differentialLogger.accept(differentialTrajectory, starting);
141    }
142    ;
143  }
144
145  private void cmdInitialize() {
146    timer.restart();
147    isActive = true;
148    timeOffset = 0.0;
149    isCompleted = false;
150    logTrajectory(true);
151  }
152
153  @SuppressWarnings("unchecked")
154  private void cmdExecute() {
155    var sample = trajectory.sampleAt(timeIntoTrajectory(), mirrorTrajectory.getAsBoolean());
156    if (sample instanceof SwerveSample swerveSample) {
157      var swerveController = (BiConsumer<Pose2d, SwerveSample>) this.controller;
158      swerveController.accept(poseSupplier.get(), swerveSample);
159    } else if (sample instanceof DifferentialSample differentialSample) {
160      var differentialController = (BiConsumer<Pose2d, DifferentialSample>) this.controller;
161      differentialController.accept(poseSupplier.get(), differentialSample);
162    }
163  }
164
165  private void cmdEnd(boolean interrupted) {
166    timer.stop();
167    isActive = false;
168    isCompleted = !interrupted;
169    cmdExecute(); // will force the controller to be fed the final sample
170    logTrajectory(false);
171  }
172
173  private boolean cmdIsFinished() {
174    return timeIntoTrajectory() > totalTime() || !routine.isActive;
175  }
176
177  /**
178   * Creates a command that allocates the drive subsystem and follows the trajectory using the
179   * factories control function
180   *
181   * @return The command that will follow the trajectory
182   */
183  public Command cmd() {
184    // if the trajectory is empty, return a command that will print an error
185    if (trajectory.samples().isEmpty()) {
186      return driveSubsystem
187          .runOnce(
188              () -> {
189                DriverStation.reportError("Trajectory " + name + " has no samples", false);
190              })
191          .withName("Trajectory_" + name);
192    }
193    return new FunctionalCommand(
194            this::cmdInitialize,
195            this::cmdExecute,
196            this::cmdEnd,
197            this::cmdIsFinished,
198            driveSubsystem)
199        .withName("Trajectory_" + name);
200  }
201
202  /**
203   * Will get the starting pose of the trajectory.
204   *
205   * <p>This position is mirrored based on the {@code mirrorTrajectory} boolean supplier in the
206   * factory used to make this trajectory
207   *
208   * @return The starting pose
209   */
210  public Optional<Pose2d> getInitialPose() {
211    if (trajectory.samples().isEmpty()) {
212      return Optional.empty();
213    }
214    return Optional.ofNullable(trajectory.getInitialPose(mirrorTrajectory.getAsBoolean()));
215  }
216
217  /**
218   * Will get the ending pose of the trajectory.
219   *
220   * <p>This position is mirrored based on the {@code mirrorTrajectory} boolean supplier in the
221   * factory used to make this trajectory
222   *
223   * @return The starting pose
224   */
225  public Optional<Pose2d> getFinalPose() {
226    if (trajectory.samples().isEmpty()) {
227      return Optional.empty();
228    }
229    return Optional.ofNullable(trajectory.getFinalPose(mirrorTrajectory.getAsBoolean()));
230  }
231
232  /**
233   * Returns a trigger that is true while the trajectory is scheduled.
234   *
235   * @return A trigger that is true while the trajectory is scheduled.
236   */
237  public Trigger active() {
238    return new Trigger(routine.loop(), () -> this.isActive && routine.isActive);
239  }
240
241  /**
242   * Returns a trigger that is true while the command is not scheduled.
243   *
244   * <p>The same as calling <code>active().negate()</code>.
245   *
246   * @return A trigger that is true while the command is not scheduled.
247   */
248  public Trigger inactive() {
249    return active().negate();
250  }
251
252  /**
253   * Returns a trigger that rises to true when the trajectory ends and falls when another trajectory
254   * is run.
255   *
256   * <p>This is different from inactive() in a few ways.
257   *
258   * <ul>
259   *   <li>This will never be true if the trajectory is interupted
260   *   <li>This will never be true before the trajectory is run
261   *   <li>This will fall the next cycle after the trajectory ends
262   * </ul>
263   *
264   * <p>Why does the trigger need to fall?
265   *
266   * <pre><code>
267   * //Lets say we had this code segment
268   * Trigger hasGamepiece = ...;
269   * Trigger noGamepiece = hasGamepiece.negate();
270   *
271   * AutoTrajectory rushMidTraj = ...;
272   * AutoTrajectory goShootGamepiece = ...;
273   * AutoTrajectory pickupAnotherGamepiece = ...;
274   *
275   * routine.enabled().onTrue(rushMidTraj.cmd());
276   *
277   * rushMidTraj.done(10).and(noGamepiece).onTrue(pickupAnotherGamepiece.cmd());
278   * rushMidTraj.done(10).and(hasGamepiece).onTrue(goShootGamepiece.cmd());
279   *
280   * // If done never falls when a new trajectory is scheduled
281   * // then these triggers leak into the next trajectory, causing the next note pickup
282   * // to trigger goShootGamepiece.cmd() even if we no longer care about these checks
283   * </code></pre>
284   *
285   * @param cyclesToDelay The number of cycles to delay the trigger from rising to true.
286   * @return A trigger that is true when the trajectoy is finished.
287   */
288  public Trigger done(int cyclesToDelay) {
289    BooleanSupplier checker =
290        new BooleanSupplier() {
291          /** The last used value for trajectory completeness */
292          boolean lastCompleteness = false;
293
294          /** The cycle to be true for */
295          int cycleTarget = -1;
296
297          @Override
298          public boolean getAsBoolean() {
299            if (!isCompleted) {
300              // update last seen value
301              lastCompleteness = false;
302              return false;
303            }
304            if (!lastCompleteness && isCompleted) {
305              // if just flipped to completed update last seen value
306              // and store the cycleTarget based of the current cycle
307              lastCompleteness = true;
308              cycleTarget = routine.pollCount() + cyclesToDelay;
309            }
310            // finally if check the cycle matches the target
311            return routine.pollCount() == cycleTarget;
312          }
313        };
314    return inactive().and(new Trigger(routine.loop(), checker));
315  }
316
317  /**
318   * Returns a trigger that rises to true when the trajectory ends and falls when another trajectory
319   * is run.
320   *
321   * <p>This is different from inactive() in a few ways.
322   *
323   * <ul>
324   *   <li>This will never be true if the trajectory is interupted
325   *   <li>This will never be true before the trajectory is run
326   *   <li>This will fall the next cycle after the trajectory ends
327   * </ul>
328   *
329   * <p>Why does the trigger need to fall?
330   *
331   * <pre><code>
332   * //Lets say we had this code segment
333   * Trigger hasGamepiece = ...;
334   * Trigger noGamepiece = hasGamepiece.negate();
335   *
336   * AutoTrajectory rushMidTraj = ...;
337   * AutoTrajectory goShootGamepiece = ...;
338   * AutoTrajectory pickupAnotherGamepiece = ...;
339   *
340   * routine.enabled().onTrue(rushMidTraj.cmd());
341   *
342   * rushMidTraj.done().and(noGamepiece).onTrue(pickupAnotherGamepiece.cmd());
343   * rushMidTraj.done().and(hasGamepiece).onTrue(goShootGamepiece.cmd());
344   *
345   * // If done never falls when a new trajectory is scheduled
346   * // then these triggers leak into the next trajectory, causing the next note pickup
347   * // to trigger goShootGamepiece.cmd() even if we no longer care about these checks
348   * </code></pre>
349   *
350   * @return A trigger that is true when the trajectoy is finished.
351   */
352  public Trigger done() {
353    return done(0);
354  }
355
356  /**
357   * Returns a trigger that will go true for 1 cycle when the desired time has elapsed
358   *
359   * @param timeSinceStart The time since the command started in seconds.
360   * @return A trigger that is true when timeSinceStart has elapsed.
361   */
362  public Trigger atTime(double timeSinceStart) {
363    // The timer shhould never be negative so report this as a warning
364    if (timeSinceStart < 0) {
365      DriverStation.reportWarning("Trigger time cannot be negative for " + name, true);
366      return offTrigger;
367    }
368
369    // The timer should never exceed the total trajectory time so report this as a warning
370    if (timeSinceStart > totalTime()) {
371      DriverStation.reportWarning(
372          "Trigger time cannot be greater than total trajectory time for " + name, true);
373      return offTrigger;
374    }
375
376    // Make the trigger only be high for 1 cycle when the time has elapsed,
377    // this is needed for better support of multi-time triggers for multi events
378    return new Trigger(
379        routine.loop(),
380        new BooleanSupplier() {
381          double lastTimestamp = timer.get();
382
383          public boolean getAsBoolean() {
384            double nowTimestamp = timer.get();
385            try {
386              return lastTimestamp < nowTimestamp && nowTimestamp >= timeSinceStart;
387            } finally {
388              lastTimestamp = nowTimestamp;
389            }
390          }
391        });
392  }
393
394  /**
395   * Returns a trigger that is true when the event with the given name has been reached based on
396   * time.
397   *
398   * <p>A warning will be printed to the DriverStation if the event is not found and the trigger
399   * will always be false.
400   *
401   * @param eventName The name of the event.
402   * @return A trigger that is true when the event with the given name has been reached based on
403   *     time.
404   */
405  public Trigger atTime(String eventName) {
406    boolean foundEvent = false;
407    Trigger trig = offTrigger;
408
409    for (var event : trajectory.getEvents(eventName)) {
410      // This could create alot of objects, could be done a more efficient way
411      // with having it all be 1 trigger that just has a list of times and checks each one each
412      // cycle
413      // or something like that. If choreo starts proposing memory issues we can look into this.
414      trig = trig.or(atTime(event.timestamp));
415      foundEvent = true;
416    }
417
418    // The user probably expects an event to exist if they're trying to do something at that event,
419    // report the missing event.
420    if (!foundEvent) {
421      DriverStation.reportWarning("Event \"" + eventName + "\" not found for " + name, true);
422    }
423
424    return trig;
425  }
426
427  /**
428   * Returns a trigger that is true when the robot is within toleranceMeters of the given pose.
429   *
430   * <p>This position is mirrored based on the {@code mirrorTrajectory} boolean supplier in the
431   * factory used to make this trajectory.
432   *
433   * @param pose The pose to check against
434   * @param toleranceMeters The tolerance in meters.
435   * @return A trigger that is true when the robot is within toleranceMeters of the given pose.
436   */
437  public Trigger atPose(Pose2d pose, double toleranceMeters) {
438    Translation2d checkedTrans =
439        mirrorTrajectory.getAsBoolean()
440            ? AllianceFlipUtil.flip(pose.getTranslation())
441            : pose.getTranslation();
442    return new Trigger(
443        routine.loop(),
444        () -> {
445          Translation2d currentTrans = poseSupplier.get().getTranslation();
446          return currentTrans.getDistance(checkedTrans) < toleranceMeters;
447        });
448  }
449
450  /**
451   * Returns a trigger that is true when the robot is within toleranceMeters of the given events
452   * pose.
453   *
454   * <p>A warning will be printed to the DriverStation if the event is not found and the trigger
455   * will always be false.
456   *
457   * @param eventName The name of the event.
458   * @param toleranceMeters The tolerance in meters.
459   * @return A trigger that is true when the robot is within toleranceMeters of the given events
460   *     pose.
461   */
462  public Trigger atPose(String eventName, double toleranceMeters) {
463    boolean foundEvent = false;
464    Trigger trig = offTrigger;
465
466    for (var event : trajectory.getEvents(eventName)) {
467      // This could create alot of objects, could be done a more efficient way
468      // with having it all be 1 trigger that just has a list of possess and checks each one each
469      // cycle or something like that.
470      // If choreo starts proposing memory issues we can look into this.
471      Pose2d pose = trajectory.sampleAt(event.timestamp, mirrorTrajectory.getAsBoolean()).getPose();
472      trig = trig.or(atPose(pose, toleranceMeters));
473      foundEvent = true;
474    }
475
476    // The user probably expects an event to exist if they're trying to do something at that event,
477    // report the missing event.
478    if (!foundEvent) {
479      DriverStation.reportWarning("Event \"" + eventName + "\" not found for " + name, true);
480    }
481
482    return trig;
483  }
484
485  /**
486   * Returns a trigger that is true when the robot is within 3 inches of the given events pose.
487   *
488   * <p>A warning will be printed to the DriverStation if the event is not found and the trigger
489   * will always be false.
490   *
491   * @param eventName The name of the event.
492   * @return A trigger that is true when the robot is within 3 inches of the given events pose.
493   */
494  public Trigger atPose(String eventName) {
495    return atPose(eventName, DEFAULT_TOLERANCE_METERS);
496  }
497
498  /**
499   * Returns a trigger that is true when the event with the given name has been reached based on
500   * time and the robot is within toleranceMeters of the given events pose.
501   *
502   * <p>A warning will be printed to the DriverStation if the event is not found and the trigger
503   * will always be false.
504   *
505   * @param eventName The name of the event.
506   * @param toleranceMeters The tolerance in meters.
507   * @return A trigger that is true when the event with the given name has been reached based on
508   *     time and the robot is within toleranceMeters of the given events pose.
509   */
510  public Trigger atTimeAndPlace(String eventName, double toleranceMeters) {
511    return atTime(eventName).and(atPose(eventName, toleranceMeters));
512  }
513
514  /**
515   * Returns a trigger that is true when the event with the given name has been reached based on
516   * time and the robot is within 3 inches of the given events pose.
517   *
518   * <p>A warning will be printed to the DriverStation if the event is not found and the trigger
519   * will always be false.
520   *
521   * @param eventName The name of the event.
522   * @return A trigger that is true when the event with the given name has been reached based on
523   *     time and the robot is within 3 inches of the given events pose.
524   */
525  public Trigger atTimeAndPlace(String eventName) {
526    return atTimeAndPlace(eventName, DEFAULT_TOLERANCE_METERS);
527  }
528
529  /**
530   * Returns an array of all the timestamps of the events with the given name.
531   *
532   * @param eventName The name of the event.
533   * @return An array of all the timestamps of the events with the given name.
534   */
535  public double[] collectEventTimes(String eventName) {
536    return trajectory.getEvents(eventName).stream().mapToDouble(e -> e.timestamp).toArray();
537  }
538
539  /**
540   * Returns an array of all the poses of the events with the given name.
541   *
542   * @param eventName The name of the event.
543   * @return An array of all the poses of the events with the given name.
544   */
545  public Pose2d[] collectEventPoses(String eventName) {
546    var times = collectEventTimes(eventName);
547    var poses = new Pose2d[times.length];
548    for (int i = 0; i < times.length; i++) {
549      poses[i] = trajectory.sampleAt(times[i], mirrorTrajectory.getAsBoolean()).getPose();
550    }
551    return poses;
552  }
553
554  @Override
555  public boolean equals(Object obj) {
556    return obj instanceof AutoTrajectory traj && name.equals(traj.name);
557  }
558}
